body:
### Describe the bug

Hello,

During a coverity static analysis of lxml, this issue was reported for the Cython generated code:

<details>
<summary> coverity snippet </summary>

```

16. lxml-6.0.2/src/lxml/objectify.c:2762:9: local_addr: Address of local variable "number".
17. lxml-6.0.2/src/lxml/objectify.c:2762:9: identity_transfer: Passing "number" as argument 3 to function "__Pyx__PyUnicode_AsDouble_Copy", which returns an offset off that argument.
25. lxml-6.0.2/src/lxml/objectify.c:2689:5: return_parm: Returning parameter "buffer".
26. lxml-6.0.2/src/lxml/objectify.c:2762:9: local_ptr_assign_ptr: Assigning: "last" = "__Pyx__PyUnicode_AsDouble_Copy(data, kind, number, start, start + length)".
28. lxml-6.0.2/src/lxml/objectify.c:2765:5: out_of_scope: Variable "number" goes out of scope.
30. lxml-6.0.2/src/lxml/objectify.c:2776:5: use_invalid: Using "last", which points to an out-of-scope variable "number".
  2774|           PyMem_Free(number);
  2775|       }
  2776|->     if (likely(end == last) || (value == (double)-1 && PyErr_Occurred())) {
  2777|           return value;
  2778|       }

21. lxml-6.0.2/src/lxml/objectify.c:48320:9: local_addr: Address of local variable "number".
22. lxml-6.0.2/src/lxml/objectify.c:48320:9: identity_transfer: Passing "number" as argument 2 to function "__Pyx__PyBytes_AsDouble_Copy", which returns an offset off that argument.
28. lxml-6.0.2/src/lxml/objectify.c:48255:5: return_parm: Returning parameter "!!parse_error_found ? NULL : buffer".
29. lxml-6.0.2/src/lxml/objectify.c:48320:9: local_ptr_assign_ptr: Assigning: "last" = "__Pyx__PyBytes_AsDouble_Copy(start, number, length)".
31. lxml-6.0.2/src/lxml/objectify.c:48323:5: out_of_scope: Variable "number" goes out of scope.
33. lxml-6.0.2/src/lxml/objectify.c:48334:5: use_invalid: Using "last", which points to an out-of-scope variable "number".
 48332|           PyMem_Free(number);
 48333|       }
 48334|->     if (likely(end == last) || (value == (double)-1 && PyErr_Occurred())) {
 48335|           return value;
 48336|       }

```

</details>

The problem comes from 2 places in the code:

https://github.com/cython/cython/blob/93fb4f1274bda266722b0423c6c02d7b9dde0bde/Cython/Utility/Optimize.c#L808-L826

and

https://github.com/cython/cython/blob/93fb4f1274bda266722b0423c6c02d7b9dde0bde/Cython/Utility/Optimize.c#L990-L1007

`last` and `end` point inside `number` and in both cases `number` is freed from the stack or the heap but `last` and `end` are still used in the comparison later, making it undefined behavior.

 Saving the comparison result in each if statements and using that later should resolve the issue.

### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

```cython
# example code
```


### Expected behaviour

_No response_

### OS

Linux

### Python version

_No response_

### Cython version

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_
title: [BUG] use-after-free in Optimize.c
